ygData.subject: RE: Charisma vs Mob Resist Part 2
ygData.msgSnippet: ... Depends on faction.  With amiable vendors, I think a charisma of around 95-100 gets you the best prices.  With indifferent vendors you need about 100-110
ygData.messageBody:
On Thu, 12 Aug 1999, Mike Roach wrote:
>
> point increments. Another example, I hear that having a
> CHA above 120 does not seem to affect NPC selling prices
> any further, i.e., CHA of 150 gives you the same selling
> price as CHA 120 - although I have no hard data to back
> this up.

Depends on faction. With amiable vendors, I think a charisma
of around 95-100 gets you the best prices. With indifferent
vendors you need about 100-110 and sometimes even that is not
enough (there's a random factor that gets reset when you
zone). I'm not sure it's possible to get best prices from
apprehensive vendors - the effect of chr seems to be capped
around 110-120. I'm pretty sure race plays a part too, and am
going to test it some more once I get my enchanter some more
illusion spells.

> Faras Tar'Linedhel
> Bard of the 24th song (I got my sparkles last night!)

Both a blessing and a curse. Your songs now look different
from a newbie bard's. Your songs now cause more lag. :-)

--
John H. Kim
kim@...
